channel.title: Tried adding a model
channel.description:
I found a model pack and I found a bunch of .mqo's. I .dat'ed them, gzipped them, made ints and everything for them. But when I use them in-game, for example the legs don't walk and just slide around and what not. If anybody knows how to fix hypervenilate@live.com
Don't call me a noob or anything because you're just wasting your time and the sooner my question is answered, the sooner this topic will be forgotten. [ And you look pretty dumb talking smack over the internet and I'll laugh at you[: ]

item.title: Tried adding a model
item.dc:creator: @Oxygenn Oxygenn
item.description:
@Oxygenn wrote:

Aight, just PM me the model and upload the video file and I’ll download the video for better quality.
So put the model and the video file in a .rar and upload it to uppit.com and PM me the link.

Read full topic

item.title: Tried adding a model
item.dc:creator: @Oxygenn Oxygenn
item.description:
@Oxygenn wrote:

Look at my above post eh? And here’s my int for it:
if(i == 14489)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want
class8.anInt174 = 14006; // Drop/Inv Model
class8.anInt165 = 14006; // Male Wield Model
class8.anInt200 = 14006; // Female Wield
class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller
class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards
class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right
class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right
class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up
class8.aString170 = “LlEeGgSs”; // Item Name
class8.aByteArray178 = “TtHhEeSsEe AaRrEe LlEeGgSs”.getBytes(); // Item Examine
}[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 21, 2009, 11:14:06 pm[/size][hr]Or you can just look here;
Anyway, I tried it. When you walk in game the model doesn’t move, it still looks like you’re just sliding around.

Read full topic

item.title: Tried adding a model
item.dc:creator: @I_r_Pwn_u I r Pwn u
item.description:
@I_r_Pwn_u wrote:

once you get a Model from the RSMV, and you recolour or model it around, the animation will be gone and it will be like if you’re wearing robes that don’t move with you. That is only IF you model it, but if you just get it from the rsmv and gzip the .dat then i guess it will leave the aims, i dont know if this might work. so backup your models before you try.

Read full topic

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Tried adding a model
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Well if the legs don’t walk, and either don’t move at all, or seem to glitch in many ways, then they are most likely to not be animated.

Read full topic
